intro: Micromeria juliana var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically broad and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
